title: Crash on certain text in pytorch with scratchpad_ being null

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
This must be the funniest bug report I ever made.

### Reproduction:
* Ryzen 7 3700 with 8 cores, 32 GB RAM
* Linux 64bit
* git clone TTS
* virtualenv
* build
* `pip install -U pip setuptools wheel`
* `pip install -U https://github.com/reuben/TTS/releases/download/ljspeech-fwd-attn-pwgan/TTS-0.0.1+92aea2a-py3-none-any.whl` -> `Successfully installed TTS-0.0.1+92aea2a h5py-2.10.0 librosa-0.7.2 parallel-wavegan-0.2.9 phonemizer-2.1`
* `python -m TTS.server.server`
* Go to http://localhost:5002 with Firefox
* Enter:
"standup: Landing top_paths not 1 PR * API changes for DeepSpeech v1.0 * Create metadata file with model export  * Analyzing the speech proxy data dump & DeepSpeech results in Firefox Voice * Evaluating impact of LMs * PR reviews * Writing some guidance for contributors in issue 2773 * QuartzNet explorations"

### Actual result:
In the browser: "Error: NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource."

On the console:
```
[INFO]  * Running on http://0.0.0.0:5002/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
 > Model input: standup: Landing top_paths not 1 PR * API changes for DeepSpeech v1.0 * Create metadata file with model export  * Analyzing the speech proxy data dump & DeepSpeech results in Firefox Voice * Evaluating impact of LMs * PR reviews * Writing some guidance for contributors in issue 2773 * QuartzNet explorations 
['standup: Landing top_paths not 1 PR * API changes for DeepSpeech v1.', '0 * Create metadata file with model export  * Analyzing the speech proxy data dump & DeepSpeech results in Firefox Voice * Evaluating impact of LMs * PR reviews * Writing some guidance for contributors in issue 2773 * QuartzNet explorations']
   | > Decoder stopped with 'max_decoder_steps
python: /pytorch/third_party/ideep/mkl-dnn/src/common/scratchpad.cpp:63: mkldnn::impl::global_scratchpad_t::global_scratchpad_t(size_t): Assertion `scratchpad_ != nullptr' failed.
Core dumped
```
and the process stopped. I.e. crashed.

This is reproducible.
